revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Review proofreading corrections, add RMB hand note, and annotate: date of letter, physician Chapin, Jesse Whitman's death, George, Martha,and Martha's letters.
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p:
i received your letter and paper with Jesse death in it poor soul i hope hes he's better off but it makes me feel very sad dident didn't the doctor say any thing about how long he was sick before he died walterWalter has doctor chappinChapin left the institution i see it wasent wasn't his name that sent you the letter
i dident didn't write to George as he will be home friday Friday or saturday Saturday he aint ain't very busy now i am sorry waltWalt you have a cold doo do you have them dissy dizzy spells you had home i shall be glad when it comes time for you to come home i have had a letter from mattyMatty she is quite smart says the children is making reckoning of your coming out there

walter i did want the envelopes with your name on i havent haven't one marthaMartha used them to write to you when she was here or i shouldent shouldn't be out) walterWalter dear you needent needn't send the order this week next week will doo) you may send the papers this week if conveinent convenient
we have had great havoc here in brooklyn Brooklyn with the storm we diden didn't feel much the effects only the smoke came down the chimney bad by spells it was a dreary day
